thesis.description: Two DNases have been isolated and separated from Novikoff ascites hepatoma by ammonium sulfate fractionation and have been further purified by chromatography on ion exchange columns of DEAE types. One of these two enzymes, called acid DNase, is active at a pH between 5.4 and 5.8, hydrolyzing native DNA much faster than denatured DNA. The other, known as alkaline DNase, has a pH optimum between 8.9 and 9.4 and hydrolyzes denatured DNA faster than native DNA. [...]
thesis.creator: Ip, Moon-Kee.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Deoxyribonucleases from Novikoff ascites hepatoma.
